title: Why are not all the characters available in my type?
content:
Hi,   
   
I have several typefaces that include special characters like L slash, Eth, Dyet, etc. But in my software (Quark 4.11, Freehand, 8, Photoshop 5.5) they are not available.   
What's wrong? Do I need other keyboard settings, do I have to upgrade something (I'm still running under OS9.2.1)?   
I would like to fix this, because typefaces with the Adobe Standard Coding don't show all the characters in my software.   
   
Does anyone have some tips or suggestions?   
   
Thanx,   
Ren�

comments.content:
There's some info [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526221259/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/19474.html).   
   
I don't know much about Macs, but I guess there's   
nothing wrong with your system. IIRC, the   
"MacEncoding" doesn't support the characters   
you're mentioning (eth, lslash, etc).

Basically, you need to use software that speaks Unicode. In some cases, this only helps if the OS also speaks Unicode fluently (e.g. OS X).   
   
You cannot access these characters in any version of QuarkXPress up to and including 6. Juergen Kurz recently said that they would add Unicode to QXP 7 (at a cost of 18 engineers for 9 months).   
   
More recent versions of Freehand reportedly do Unicode (may require OS X). Photoshop certainly does. Any version of InDesign does. Depending on the application you may need to change keyboard settings to enter these characters, or use the OS X character palette. In Illustrator CS and InDesign, you can use the built-in glyph palette.   
   
Cheers,   
   
T
